methodology: Cheapest advertised plan at 100+ Mbps download, with Auto Pay where required. Intro/promotional pricing noted separately from regular rates where available. Equipment fees excluded from base price but noted. Prices verified against provider websites and BroadbandNow.

Spectrum.equipment: Free modem; $10/mo WiFi fee on this tier
Spectrum.notes: Intro rate for 12 months; regular price not disclosed. Next tier (500 Mbps) is $50/mo intro.

Optimum.notes: 5-year price lock with Auto Pay & Paperless Billing. 300 Mbps tier discontinued; cheapest 100+ plan is now 200 Mbps at $25/mo but that's below 100 Mbps threshold for some cable areas. 500 Mbps at $30 is the reliable 100+ option.

Verizon FiOS.notes: 3-year price lock guarantee. Requires Auto Pay. $35/mo with Verizon mobile bundle.

T-Mobile.notes: Fixed wireless; speeds vary by location (typically 100–245 Mbps). 5-year price guarantee. $35/mo with T-Mobile voice line.

Frontier.notes: Intro rate $44.99/mo for 12 months with Auto Pay & Paperless Bill. Regular price not disclosed. Fiber 200 at $29.99/mo is below 100 Mbps in some configs.

Greenlight Networks.notes: Rochester/Buffalo-area fiber ISP. Base price raised from $50 to $55 in early 2026. Consumer Reports #1 rated ISP 2024.

Starlink.notes: Satellite; speeds vary (typically 100–200 Mbps). $90/mo in high-capacity areas; $50/mo 100 Mbps tier in select areas.

Windstream.notes: Intro rate $24.99/mo for 12 months with Auto Pay. Regular price not disclosed. Fiber areas only; DSL tier is 50 Mbps at $44.99/mo.

Slic Network.notes: North Country fiber ISP (rebranded as SLICFiber). Pricing not published on website — shown as 'TBD' on Broadband Facts labels. Plans start at 200 Mbps.
